privacy.title: PROTOCOL AGREEMENT
privacy.intro: **Important Notice:** This project (Black Cat Target Manifestation Effect Study) aims to validate the **far transfer effect** of attention training. To ensure scientific rigor, we require your explicit consent for the following data collection and usage:
privacy.section1_item1: **Demographic Information:** Nickname, age, gender, and occupation (used for controlling confounding variables).
privacy.section1_item2: **Questionnaire Scores:** Cognitive baseline and Subjective Manifestation Frequency ratings.
privacy.section1_item3: **Training Performance Metrics:** Task completion time, accuracy, and timely self-reported performance.
privacy.section1_item4: **Storage Platform:** All data will be securely stored on the **Firebase Cloud Platform**.
privacy.section2_item1: **Purpose:** To validate the **objective effect** of training, overcoming reliance solely on subjective reports.
privacy.section2_item2: **Data Type:** Your camera will be used to record your **Gaze Coordinates** and **Fixation Duration** on the screen.
privacy.section2_item3: **Data Filtering:** Low-quality eye-tracking data (e.g., excessive calibration error) will be **strictly filtered and excluded**.
privacy.section2_item4: **Commitment:** Camera data is used solely for scientific analysis and will **not** record video or be used for facial recognition.
privacy.section3_desc: You may withdraw from the study at any time by contacting the researchers. Your data will be **anonymized**. We commit that all collected data will be handled **strictly in accordance with privacy regulations** and used only for the scientific purpose of this experiment.

questions.Q1: I am good at observing details and can spot things in my surroundings that others do not notice.
questions.Q2: I can focus on my goals for a long time, even when there is a lot of noise or hustle.
questions.Q3: I can construct the image of a "Black Cat" in my mind easily and vividly.
questions.Q4: I can precisely manipulate the imaginary "Black Cat" in my mind.
questions.Q5: I think it is important to improve the ability to spot specific objects.
questions.Q6: I am looking forward to seeing an increase in black cat sightings.
questions.Q7: I will take the initiative to look for "Black Cat" related visual stimuli.
questions.Q8: I feel refreshed and ready to begin a highly focused task.

0.title: Miller's Law
0.content: The number of objects an average human can hold in working memory is about 7 Â± 2. This is why phone numbers are typically 7-8 digits.

1.title: The Stroop Effect
1.content: A delay in reaction time occurs when the name of a color (e.g., 'blue') is printed in a different color (e.g., red).

2.title: Zeigarnik Effect
2.content: People remember uncompleted or interrupted tasks better than completed tasks. The brain holds 'cognitive tension' until closure.

3.title: Change Blindness
3.content: When a visual scene is disrupted (e.g., by blinking), large changes can occur without being noticed. This proves attention is finite.

4.title: Serial Position Effect
4.content: When recalling a list, people tend to remember the first items (primacy) and last items (recency) best.

access_denied.title: ACCESS DENIED
access_denied.g4_msg: Protocol G4 does not include community access.

guide.g1_desc: Using 'Predictive Coding' theory, we reconstruct the world in our minds. Close your eyes, resonate with the target. To imagine is to see.
guide.g2_desc: Attention is the spotlight of perception. Through dynamic tracking, we train 'Precision Weighting'. Lock onto the target amidst chaos.
guide.g3_desc: Symphony of inner and outer. Combining imagery rehearsal with visual capture to open dual pathways of perception.
guide.g4_desc: Working memory is the cornerstone of cognition. Expand your cognitive bandwidth via N-Back to reserve energy for awareness.

confirm_modal.title: CONFIRM NEURAL TEMPLATE?
confirm_modal.warning: By saving, you are locking your brain's search parameters for this session.

1.title: PHASE I: TEMPLATE CONSTRUCTION
1.subtitle: Goal: Visual Prior Establishment
1.content:
Subject is authorized to access Level 1 protocols.

According to Predictive Coding Theory, the brain requires a strong initial 'Visual Template' to lower perception thresholds.

Today's Objective:
Establish the base contour of the target. Focus on high-contrast features (Neck & Face) to imprint the initial neural representation.

2.title: PHASE II: FEATURE ANCHORING
2.subtitle: Goal: Saliency Enhancement
2.content:
Level 2 Clearance Granted.

Initiating 'Attentional Anchor' protocol. The system will now introduce high-saliency features (e.g., Luminous Eyes, Headgear).

These unique color singularities act as 'hooks' to bind attention to the target object, preventing feature separation in working memory.

3.title: PHASE III: NOISE FILTERING
3.subtitle: Goal: Precision Weighting
3.content:
WARNING: Environmental Noise Detected.

Level 3 introduces 'Distractors' and 'Body Noise' to simulate real-world entropy.

Your visual cortex must now perform 'Precision Weighting'â€”suppressing background signals while amplifying the target prediction. This is critical for stabilizing the Target Manifestation Effect (TME).

4.name: Bowtie
4.desc: Color Anchor: Red/yellow contrast breaks camouflage.

7.name: Necklace
7.desc: Luminance Cue: Reflective surface for low-light detection.

21.name: Blush
21.desc: Local Contrast: Increases facial recognition probability.

1.name: Crown
1.desc: Geometric Peak: Trains identification of sharp outlines.

5.name: Halo
5.desc: Floating Signifier: Expands vertical scan range.

3.name: Headphones
3.desc: Volume Extension: Lateral extension of bounding box.

18.name: Mouth
18.desc: Internal Detail: Fills missing facial data.

16.name: Angel Wings
16.desc: Spatial Dominance: Maximizes contrast and size.

13.name: Cloud
13.desc: Upper Field Noise: Diverts attention from ground.

14.name: Grass
14.desc: Bottom Field Noise: Simulates camouflage environment.

g1.mission_2: Build stable mental imagery and enhance target sensitivity.

g1.step_1_desc: Deep inhale... Slow exhale. Let your shoulders drop.
g1.step_2_desc: Put aside other tasks. This time belongs to you.
g1.rehearse_desc: Reconstruct the image until it becomes clear...

g4.title: G4: N-Back (Lv.{{level}})
g4.rule: Rule: Match if current = {{level}} step(s) back

progress.title: Growth Track
progress.tip: Tip: Daily training is key to triggering TME.

g1.intro: Welcome to your mental visualization space. Find a comfortable posture and gently relax your shoulders. Take a deep, grounding breath. We are about to begin building your inner vision.
g1.observe_start: Gently rest your gaze on the black cat before you. There is no need to analyze, simply observe. Notice the texture of its fur and the curve of its silhouette, as if greeting an old friend.
g1.observe_mid: Maintain your soft gaze. Try to capture the glimmer in its eyes. Let this image plant itself like a seed, deep within your mind.
g1.rehearse_start: Now, gently close your eyes. Disconnect from the outside world. In the safe space of your mind, invite the black cat to appear again. Visualize it sitting there quietly, vivid and real.
g1.rehearse_deep: Make the image sharper. Can you see the rise and fall of its fur as it breathes? Hold this image. Let it be the anchor of your consciousness.
g1.end: Wonderful. Slowly open your eyes, letting the light gently return. Carry this heightened perception with you into the present moment.

g2.intro: Welcome to dynamic focus training. Relax your eye muscles. Prepare to enter a state of flow.
g2.tracking: The target has appeared. Embrace the target in the red frame with your gaze. No matter the noise around you, only the target exists in your world.
g2.focus_reinforce: Keep your breathing steady. Your gaze is like a beam of lightâ€”stable and strong. Ignore the distractions; they are merely drifting leaves.
g2.end: Session complete. Close your eyes for a moment and feel the calm strength of your focus.

voice_guide.g3_transition: Now, we will shift from inner imagination to outer focus. Carry the image of the black cat with you as we begin tracking.
